title: Rockism and poptimism
summary: Rockism (a term used similarly as "racism"[2]) is the belief that rock music is dependent on values such as authenticity and artfulness, and that such values elevate the genre over other forms of popular music.[3] So-called "rockists" may promote the artifices stereotyped in rock music[4][3] or may regard the genre as the normative state of popular music.[5] Poptimism (or popism[1]) is the belief that pop music is as worthy of professional critique and interest as rock music.[6] Detractors of poptimism describe it as a counterpart of rockism that unfairly privileges the most famous or best-selling pop, hip hop, and R&B acts.[7][8]
